editorialDecl.p: A taxonomy of syriaca-tag attribute values referenced by Syriaca.org resources.

category.gloss: The name used by Syriaca.org for document titles, citation, and disambiguation.
category.desc: These names have been created according to the Syriaca.org guidelines for headwords: http://syriaca.org/documentation/headwords.html.

category.gloss: An anglicized version of a name, included to facilitate searching.
category.desc: Anglicized names are marked to better facilitate searching and display. If a name marked as anglicized does not cite a specific source using the source attribute, it may or may not be attested in the literature and has been added by the Syriaca.org editors or contributors simply to aid readers.

category.gloss: A description used to identify a person or persons for whom no proper name is known.
category.desc: Names marked with #anonymous-description are not, properly speaking, names, but rather descriptions that the Syriaca.org editors have composed in place of a name to identify a person or persons whose name is not attested in available sources. The editors compose these descriptions on the bases of the sources which mention the person(s), but the descriptions do not necessarily use the exact wording of the sources. In the rare case that a name becomes known, the name marked with anonymous-description will be kept. Anonymous persons are also marked with a #syriaca-headword name in the form "Anonymous " or "Anonymi " + the numeric portion of the URI and with a trait having the value "anonymous".

body.head: syriaca-tag Attribute Values Used in Syriaca.org Resources
body.p: Syriaca.org uses the custom global attribute syriaca-tags for labeling data in ways beyond what TEI natively supports. As of May 18, 2016, the attribute has been used exclusively on the elements persName, placeName, and title. However, it may be used on other elements as the need arises.
Records that use the syriaca-tags attribute must be validated against the custom Syriaca schema: http://syriaca.org/documentation/syriaca-tei-main.rnc.
